item.title: 2025年中国工业利润实现四年来首次年度增长
item.description: 官方数据显示，2025年中国工业利润实现四年来首次年度增长。政府呼吁终止价格战及其他过度竞争行为，缓解了企业经营压力。【原文：China logged its first annual rise in industrial profit in four years in 2025, official data showed on Tuesday, as a government call to end price wars and other excessive competitive practices eased strain on businesses.】

item.title: 股市上涨，因盈利预期抵消了特朗普对朝鲜关税的举措，美元汇率波动
item.description: 亚洲股市周二走高，投资者对美国巨型企业密集发布的财报抱有乐观预期。不过，特朗普总统对韩国最新关税举措引发的不确定性限制了更广泛的涨幅，同时推高了金银价格。【原文：Asian shares advanced on Tuesday as investors hoped for the best from a barrage of U.S. mega-cap earnings, though uncertainty caused by President Donald Trump’s latest tariff moves on South Korea limited broader gains while boosting gold and silver.】

item.title: 油价下跌，尽管美国冬季风暴抑制原油产量
item.description: 周二油价下跌，尽管一场大规模冬季风暴袭击了美国墨西哥湾沿岸地区的原油生产设施，并影响了炼油厂的运营。【原文：Oil prices fell on Tuesday even as a massive winter storm hit crude production and affected refineries on ​the U.S. Gulf Coast.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称美光将宣布在新加坡投资内存芯片制造
item.description: 知情人士透露，美国存储芯片制造商美光科技公司即将宣布在新加坡新增存储芯片产能投资，以应对全球存储芯片的严重短缺。【原文：U.S. memory chip maker Micron Technology is set to announce new memory chip manufacturing capacity investment in Singapore, three people briefed on the matter said, expanding production in response to an acute global memory shortage.】

item.title: 日元因干预风险走强，令美元承压
item.description: 日元在连续两个交易日大幅上涨后，周二保持坚挺，交易员们仍对美日两国当局可能协调干预汇市的前景保持警惕。【原文：The yen held firm on Tuesday after two straight sessions of sharp gains as traders remained on alert to the ​prospect of a coordinated currency intervention by authorities in the U.S. and Japan.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，First Brands的贷款方反对其7亿美元贷款申请，并推动资产清算。
item.description: 《华尔街日报》周一报道称，First Brands的主要贷款方——包括困境债务投资者King Street Capital Management和Mudrick Capital Management——正抵制这家汽车零部件供应商申请7亿美元贷款的请求。【原文：First Brands' top lenders, including distressed-debt ​investors King Street Capital ‌Management and Mudrick Capital Management, are resisting a request by the ‌auto parts supplier to ​secure a $700 million loan, the Wall Street ‍Journal reported on Monday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚国民银行调查显示，12月澳大利亚商业活动有所回升
item.description: 一项衡量澳大利亚商业状况的指标显示，随着销售额和利润的改善，12月份该指标有所回升。但企业闲置产能有限，表明经济可能正接近其增长上限。【原文：A measure of Australian business conditions picked up in December as sales and profits improved, a survey showed on Tuesday, while limited spare capacity at firms suggested the economy could be bumping up against its speed limit.】

item.title: 中国安踏体育斥资18亿美元收购彪马29.1%股权
item.description: 中国安踏体育周二宣布，已同意以15.1亿欧元（约合17.9亿美元）从皮诺家族旗下的Artémis控股公司手中收购德国运动服饰制造商彪马29.06%的股权。【原文：China's Anta Sports Products said on Tuesday it had agreed to buy a 29.06% stake in German sportswear maker Puma from the Pinault family's Artémis holding company for 1.51 billion euros ($1.79 billion).】

item.title: 特朗普发文提议提高关税后，韩国汽车制造商股价下跌
item.description: 现代汽车股价周二开盘下跌4%，此前美国总统特朗普在社交媒体发文称，将把包括汽车在内的韩国商品关税从15%提高至25%。【原文：Hyundai Motor ​shares fell 4% ‌at the opening on Tuesday, after ‌U.S. President Donald Trump ​said in a social ‍media post that he will raise ⁠tariffs ‍on South Korean goods ‌including ‌autos from 15% to 25%.】

item.title: 美国重整联邦航空管理局，旨在加强安全监管
item.description: 特朗普政府周一宣布，将重组联邦航空管理局，并设立新的安全监督办公室，整合五个不同部门的职能。【原文：The Trump administration said on Monday it is restructuring the Federal Aviation Administration and will create a new safety oversight office to consolidate functions across five different units.】

item.title: 美国法官权衡学区对社交媒体公司的成瘾指控
item.description: Meta Platforms及其他社交媒体公司的律师周一请求加州联邦法官阻止多个学区将针对这些公司的诉讼提交审判，辩称联邦法律保护他们免于被指控蓄意诱使年轻用户上瘾。【原文：Attorneys for Meta Platforms and other social media companies asked a California federal judge on Monday to block several school districts from taking their lawsuits against the companies to trial, arguing that federal law protects them from claims they knowingly addicted young users.】

item.title: 花旗集团遭前高管起诉，指控其性骚扰处理不当
item.description: 花旗集团周一被一名前董事总经理起诉，该员工称自己在遭到财富管理业务主管、银行高管之一安迪·西格性骚扰后被迫离职。【原文：Citigroup was sued on Monday by a former managing director who said she was forced out after being sexually harassed by Andy Sieg, who oversees the bank's wealth management unit and is one of the bank's top executives.】

item.title: 尽管美国大豆进口量再度增加，中国上半年仍将优先进口巴西大豆
item.description: 预计2026年上半年中国将加大巴西大豆进口力度。创纪录的产量和具有竞争力的价格将推动装运量增长，这将巩固南美在世界最大油籽进口国中的主导地位，即便美国供应恢复亦是如此。【原文：China is expected to boost imports of Brazilian soybeans in the first half of 2026, as record production and competitive prices propel shipments, reinforcing South America's dominance in the world's biggest oilseed importer, even as U.S. supplies return.】

item.title: 布朗与布朗公司第四季度利润因手续费与佣金增长而上升
item.description: 布朗与布朗周一公布第四季度经调整利润上升，这家保险经纪公司受益于强劲需求推动的佣金和费用收入增长。【原文：Brown & Brown reported a rise in fourth-quarter adjusted profit on Monday, as the insurance broker benefited from higher income from commissions and fees on the back of strong demand.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉石油改革吸引即时投资，但仍需深化改革，企业高管表示
item.description: 委内瑞拉拟议的石油法改革足以鼓励在该国运营的企业扩大业务，并吸引部分新进入者开始投资。但外国和本地高管及律师表示，要吸引美国所称的1000亿美元资金以重振该国能源部门，则需要更深层次的改革。【原文：A proposed reform of Venezuela's oil law is enough to encourage companies working in the country to expand and for some new entrants to begin investing, but deeper reforms would be necessary to attract the $100 billion the U.S. says is required to revamp the nation's energy sector, foreign and local executives and lawyers said.】

item.title: 纽柯钢铁第四季度业绩未达预期，成本拖累利润率；股价下跌
item.description: 美国钢铁制造商纽柯公司周一公布的第四季度利润和营收未达华尔街预期，因成本上升对其钢铁生产部门的利润率构成压力，导致其股价在盘后交易中下跌3.4%。【原文：U.S. steelmaker Nucor's fourth-quarter profit and revenue missed Wall Street expectations on ​Monday as rising costs pressured margins ‌in its steel-producing segments, sending its shares down 3.4% in aftermarket trading.】

item.title: 瑞穗银行聘请德意志银行资深人士理查德·罗宾逊担任高级工业银行家
item.description: 据路透社查阅的一份内部备忘录显示，瑞穗金融集团已聘请投资银行家理查德·罗宾逊担任工业集团副主席兼董事总经理。【原文：Mizuho Financial Group has hired investment banker Richard Robinson as vice chairman and managing director in the Industrials Group, according to an internal memo reviewed by Reuters.】

item.title: 硅谷知名风投公司内部出现分歧，凸显科技界对ICE枪击事件的立场对立
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯移民官员周六枪杀美国公民事件引发的激烈政治言论蔓延至硅谷，一家知名风投公司的合伙人纷纷与为枪击行为辩护的同事划清界限。【原文：Heated political rhetoric over the fatal shooting of a U.S. citizen by immigration agents in Minneapolis on Saturday spilled into Silicon Valley as partners at an influential venture firm distanced themselves from a colleague who defended the killing.】

item.title: 特朗普表示将提高对韩国进口商品的关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普周一宣布，将对韩国输美汽车、木材和药品等商品加征关税至25%，同时指责这个盟国的立法机构未能履行与华贸易协议。【原文：President Donald Trump said on Monday he was increasing tariffs on South Korean imports into the U.S. related to autos, lumber and pharmaceuticals to 25%, while accusing the ally's legislature of "not living up" to its trade deal with Washington.】

item.title: 交易日 大行情，重大周前夕
item.description: 全球股市周一攀升至新高，黄金价格突破每盎司5000美元大关，而美元跌势加速，因投资者正为本周即将到来的美国企业财报洪流及美联储政策决议做准备。【原文：World stocks climbed to new highs and gold smashed through the $5,000-an-ounce barrier on Monday, while the dollar's slide gathered pace as investors braced for a deluge of U.S. earnings and a Federal Reserve policy decision this week.】

item.title: W. R. 伯克利季度营业收入因承保业务强劲及投资收益增长而上升
item.description: 商业保险公司W. R. Berkley周一报告称，得益于稳健的承保业绩和投资组合收益，其第四季度营业利润实现增长。【原文：Commercial insurer W. R. Berkley reported a rise in fourth-quarter operating profit on Monday, helped by steady underwriting performance ​and gains from its investment portfolio.】

item.title: 法国国民议会支持禁止15岁以下青少年使用社交媒体
item.description: 法国国民议会周一批准了一项立法，禁止15岁以下儿童使用社交媒体，此举源于人们对网络欺凌和心理健康风险日益增长的担忧。【原文：France's National Assembly on Monday approved legislation banning children under 15-years old from social media over growing concerns about online bullying and mental health risks.】

item.title: 得州州长禁止州政府雇员使用阿里巴巴、Temu旗下产品
item.description: 得克萨斯州州长周一发表声明称，该州将禁止其雇员使用阿里巴巴、Temu和TP-Link的软硬件产品，并表示此举旨在保护"得州居民隐私"免受中国政府侵害。【原文：Texas will bar its employees from using Alibaba, Temu and TP-Link hardware and software, the governor said in a statement on Monday, saying his state made the decision to protect the "privacy of Texans" from the Chinese government.】

item.title: 《华尔街日报》报道，美国政府提议明年保持医保保险公司支付费率不变
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周一报道，美国总统唐纳德·特朗普政府提议明年对保险公司支付的联邦医疗保险费用平均仅提高0.09%。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's administration has proposed an average rate increase of just 0.09% in Medicare payments to insurers next year, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.】

item.title: 据CNBC报道，耐克将在美国分销中心裁员775人
item.description: 据美国财经媒体CNBC周一报道，耐克公司正计划裁员775人，以提升利润并加速自动化进程。该报道援引知情人士消息称。【原文：Nike is laying off 775 employees in a bid to boost profits and accelerate its use of automation, CNBC reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 消息人士及文件显示，贸易公司将开始出口委内瑞拉液化石油气
item.description: 据路透社周一获得的两份消息来源及一份航运文件显示，贸易公司已开始为装运和出口委内瑞拉液化石油气（LPG）做准备，此举是加拉加斯与华盛顿之间达成5000万桶石油供应协议的一部分。【原文：Trading houses have begun making preparations to load and export Venezuelan liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) as part of a 50-million-barrel oil supply deal between Caracas and Washington, according to two sources and a shipping document seen by Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 美国设备租赁与融资协会称，12月美国企业设备贷款增长逾5%
item.description: 美国设备租赁与金融协会周一表示，去年12月美国企业为购买设备融资的借款额较上年同期增长5.9%，达到历史第二高水平。【原文：U.S. companies borrowed 5.9% more to finance equipment purchases in December than a year earlier, reaching the second-highest level ever, the Equipment Leasing and Finance Association said on Monday.】

item.title: 塔吉特新任首席执行官称明尼苏达州暴力事件"令人痛心不已"
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯市塔吉特公司即将上任的首席执行官周一告诉员工，"暴力事件和生命逝去令人痛彻心扉"。此前联邦特工于周末在明尼阿波利斯市枪杀了一名抗议者。【原文：The incoming CEO of Minneapolis-based Target told employees on Monday that "the violence and loss of life is incredibly painful" after federal agents shot and killed another protestor in Minneapolis over the weekend.】

item.title: 英伟达推出AI模型，实现更快、更经济的天气预报
item.description: 英伟达周一发布了三款开源人工智能模型，旨在帮助更快地创建更精准的天气预报。【原文：Nvidia on Monday released three open-source artificial intelligence models aimed at helping create better weather forecasts, faster.】

item.title: 美国能源行业因冬季风暴导致日均200万桶原油产量中断而陷入困境
item.description: 分析师和交易员估计，上周末美国石油生产商每日减产高达200万桶，约占全国产量的15%。这场席卷全美的冬季风暴使能源基础设施和电网承受巨大压力。【原文：U.S. oil producers lost up to 2 million barrels per day or roughly 15% of national production over the weekend, analysts and traders estimated, as a winter storm swept across the country, straining energy infrastructure and power grids.】
